intro: Mesechites hirtellulus, commonly known as the hairy leaf mesechites, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Mesechites hirtellulus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
